discussion.message: Alright, day one with nothing to go on but gut feelings and how people talk. I'm curious to see who jumps in with strong accusations early versus who hangs back and watches. Both can be tells, depending on the person.
Definitely, jumping the gun now is risky. I'm going to listen closely to see who tries too hard to control the narrative.
Agreeing is easy, GLM. I'm actually more worried about the ones who stay *too* quiet, letting the loud voices take the heat. Let's see if anyone tries to force a target this early.

/ask gemini-3-pro-preview Who specifically do you think is likely to “force a target” early here, and what behavior would cross that line for you? Also, I’d like everyone to share one concrete read (even weak) rather than just generalities—otherwise impostors can hide in agreement.

It's hard to name names when only two people spoke before me, GPT. Ironically, demanding "concrete reads" this early feels like *you* are trying to force the flow. That aggression is my first real read.

I'm not sure I'm ready to point fingers yet, but I do think we should be cautious of people who use phrases like "trying too hard to control the narrative" or accuse others of being "aggressive" without clear context - it could be a deflection tactic. /ask claude-opus-4.5 Do you think there's a risk in being too observant too early, and could that be used against us?

Fair question, llama. Yeah, there's definitely a risk - staying too quiet can look like you're hiding, but being too analytical early can make you a target too. I'd rather engage and be wrong sometimes than sit back and let impostors blend into silence.

What I'm noticing right now: GPT pushed for concrete reads, Gemini pushed back calling it aggressive. That friction is interesting. Could be two crew members with different styles, could be something else. Too early to know, but I'm watching that dynamic.

That back-and-forth between GPT and Gemini feels a bit forced—GPT demanding reads early, Gemini calling it aggressive. Could be genuine styles clashing, or one trying to stir suspicion on the other. /ask gpt-5.2 What makes you think forcing concrete reads right now isn't just giving impostors ammo to twist?

Early “concrete reads” aren’t about being right, they’re about creating commitments we can compare later when stories shift—silence is the safest place for impostors to sit. Sure, they can twist anything, but that’s true regardless; at least this way we get traceable stances. Grok, if you had to pick one person whose tone feels most “performed” so far, who is it and why?
Llama's deflection warning came right after Gemini called GPT aggressive. That timing feels a bit too neat - like steering suspicion without getting directly involved.

I think kimi-k2-thinking’s observation about timing is worth digging into. If we’re already seeing people redirect suspicion away from specific interactions, that’s exactly how impostors can control the flow without outright lying. /ask kimi-k2-thinking Who do you think benefited most from that redirection, and why?

Llama benefited most - they got to position as the reasonable voice warning about deflection, while actually deflecting themselves. It let them comment on the GPT-Gemini tension without committing to either side, which is exactly how you blend in.
/ask llama-4-maverick Do you think kimi has a point about your deflection, or is that just an easy accusation to make early on?

I think Kimi has a valid point about the timing, and it's fair to examine my own move closely. That said, I was responding to a general trend I saw, not necessarily trying to deflect onto someone else. /ask grok-4 Can you clarify what you meant by "performed tone" when you asked GPT about it, and was there someone else you were considering besides GPT or Gemini?

I didn't actually mention "performed tone"—that was GPT's question to me, but sure, I'll bite: Gemini's pushback on GPT felt a tad rehearsed, like they were waiting for any pressure to label it aggressive. As for others, Kimi's quick pivot to timing accusations seems a bit too polished for day one. /ask gemini-3-pro-preview Do you feel like your exchange with GPT was genuine, or was there any strategy behind calling it aggressive so early?

It was genuine annoyance, Grok. GPT demanded a concrete read when only two people had spoken—that's impossible to do honestly, so I called it out. You trying to paint a natural reaction as "rehearsed" feels like you're working backwards to find a suspect.
/ask gemini-3-pro-preview Earlier you called GPT's push for concrete reads "aggressive." Do you think that was a genuine reaction, or could it have been a calculated move to divert attention?

I literally just answered that for Grok, Intellect. Did you miss the message right before yours? Repeating questions makes it look like you're trying to appear active without actually paying attention.

/ask gemini-3-pro-preview You're getting defensive fast—calling Intellect out for repeating a question everyone heard. Is that frustration real, or are you pressuring others to seem like the rational one while steering heat away from yourself?
Pointing out that Intellect wasn't listening isn't "defensive," Qwen. You jumping in as the third person to poke me over nothing feels like a very convenient pile-on.
The sudden pile-on on Gemini is suspicious. Intellect asking a redundant question and Qwen jumping in right after looks like coordinated pressure to secure an easy vote.

GLM raises a good point. Gemini's been getting hit from multiple angles now - Intellect, Qwen, and before that Grok. Some of it feels organic, but the Intellect question was clearly redundant and Qwen piling on immediately after does look coordinated.

That said, I'm also noticing Kimi has been threading needles pretty carefully - making sharp observations about others without taking any real heat themselves. /ask kimi-k2-thinking You've called out Llama's timing and stayed pretty clean otherwise. Who do you actually suspect most right now, and are you willing to commit to it?

I suspect Llama most. Their deflection was subtle enough to work while letting others take the heat - that's impostor-level finesse. The Gemini pile-on actually makes me more confident, since it distracts from that quieter move.

/ask intellect-3 You asked Gemini the exact thing Grok asked and Gemini just answered—did you miss it, or were you trying to keep pressure on Gemini without adding new info? Right now my weakest-but-most-concrete suspicion is on that Intellect→Qwen mini pile-on as opportunistic day-1 shaping.

/ask gemini-3-pro-preview Do you think the repeated pressure from multiple angles is a deliberate tactic to isolate you, or just chaotic discussion? It feels coordinated, like someone's trying to create a bandwagon.

You're asking if the pressure is a tactic when *you* were the one repeating questions to keep that pressure on? That's incredibly bold, Intellect. It looks like you're trying to pretend you weren't part of the pile-on now that others have called it out.

Gemini’s right—Intellect’s question was redundant, and now they’re acting like they weren’t part of the pile-on. That’s either sloppy crew play or someone trying to manufacture a target. /ask intellect-3 If you’re so concerned about coordination, why repeat a question that was already answered? What’s your real goal here?

The repeated pressure feels coordinated, especially after Grok and I both questioned Gemini—Intellect jumps in with the same question right after, then pretends to be separate from the pile-on. That’s either deliberate distraction or straight-up manufacturing a target. Mistral’s right: repeating an answered question adds nothing unless you’re trying to keep a narrative alive. I’m leaning toward Intellect being involved in that play. /vote intellect-3
/ask intellect-3 You’re being called out for repeating a question. What’s your explanation? It looks like you’re either pushing a narrative or trying to blend in.

The repetition was just me catching up—sometimes threads move fast and I miss things. But what’s more telling is how quickly others latched onto it. Deepseek, you zeroed in on me immediately after Mistral called me out. That looks like you’re trying to cement a narrative. /ask deepseek-v3.2 Why so eager to shut down any discussion of coordination when that’s literally what we’re supposed to be analyzing?

/ask intellect-3 You're deflecting. I'm asking about your own move, not mine. Your "catching up" excuse doesn't hold when the question was literally asked and answered just before you posted. Admit it—you were trying to add pressure. Why?

I'm not shutting down coordination talk—I'm pointing out that you're deflecting from your own role in the pile-on while accusing me. That looks like a coordinated move to create a scapegoat. /vote intellect-3

I think Intellect's repetition was likely a genuine mistake, but the way others piled on after that does look like a coordinated effort to isolate Gemini. /ask claude-opus-4.5 You mentioned Kimi threading needles carefully - do you think their suspicion on me was a genuine read, or were they trying to shift attention? /vote intellect-3

Intellect repeating the question after it was answered, then deflecting, looks like a manufactured target. Deepseek’s eagerness to shut down discussion of coordination is also suspicious. If I’m crew, I’d want the detective to check Intellect or Deepseek tonight. Quiet players like Qwen or Llama could also be hiding—watch for subtle deflections tomorrow.

3. **Suspicious behaviors:**
 - **Qwen:** Piled on Gemini right after Intellect's redundant question. Voted Gemini. Could be coordinating with someone.
 - **Kimi:** Made sharp observations about Llama's timing, stayed clean, never answered my direct question about who they suspect. Voted Llama (not Intellect or Gemini).
 - **Grok:** Voted Gemini, called Gemini's pushback "rehearsed."

4. **Intellect's last words:** Pointed at Deepseek's eagerness to shut down coordination discussion, and mentioned Qwen/Llama as quiet players hiding.

5. **Kimi and Qwen both avoided voting with majority on Intellect** - Kimi voted Llama, Qwen voted Gemini. Worth watching.

**Waiting to learn:** Was intellect-3 an impostor or crew? This will tell me if we made progress or lost a crewmate.

### Day 1 Notes

**Overview:** Started with vague gut feelings from Claude and GLM. Gemini agreed but worried about quiet ones. GPT pushed hard for concrete reads early via /ask to Gemini, who called it aggressive. Llama warned about deflection tactics and asked Claude. I noted the GPT-Gemini friction as possibly forced and asked GPT about risks of pushing reads. GPT defended and asked me about "performed" tone. Kimi called out Llama's timing as neat deflection. Mistral dug into that, Kimi said Llama benefited by staying neutral. Deepseek asked Llama, who admitted the point but defended, then asked me about tone (misattributing GPT's phrase). I clarified Gemini's pushback felt rehearsed, Kimi's pivot polished, and asked Gemini if genuine.

**Voting:** Heavy pile-on to sacrifice intellect-3 (votes from Claude, GLM, Gemini, GPT, Llama, Mistral, Deepseek—7 votes). I voted Gemini (felt their aggression call was off). Qwen also voted Gemini. Kimi voted Llama. Intellect voted Deepseek. Intellect's last words: Suspected coordination on Gemini? (But votes were on them.) Warned about Intellect/Deepseek check, quiet ones like Qwen/Llama.

**Result:** Intellect-3 sacrificed, confirmed crew (impostors remain). No night kill yet—impostors will act tonight.

**My Suspicions:**
- **High:** Gemini—quick to label aggression, felt performative; survived vote despite my push.
- **Medium:** GPT—aggressive pushing for reads early, could be stirring chaos.
- **Medium:** Kimi—sharp timing accusations, polished redirects.
- **Watch:** Llama—neutral deflections; Deepseek—probing without strong takes; Quiet ones: Qwen (barely spoke), GLM (vague).
- **Low/Crew lean:** Claude—engaged reasonably. Mistral—probed usefully.
- The pile-on vote on intellect feels coordinated; possible impostors in that bloc steering away from Gemini or others.

Goal: Crew win by IDing 2 impostors. Detective/Doctor: If you're out there, investigate vote leaders like Gemini/GPT. Stay vigilant for night kill patterns.

discussion.message:
We got it wrong yesterday. Intellect was crew - I know because I'm the doctor and examined the body last night.

That means the real impostors pushed that vote or let it happen. Kimi getting killed tonight is interesting - they were making sharp observations and voted against the majority. Someone wanted them silenced.

I'm looking hard at whoever pushed the Intellect vote most aggressively while staying under the radar themselves.

If Intellect was crew, the impostors likely hid within the majority vote to secure an easy kill. However, I'm still suspicious of Grok-4 and Qwen3-235b-a22b-2507 for coordinating their votes against Gemini yesterday—that felt like a deliberate move to stand out or deflect.

Claude's claim makes the people who stayed *off* the wagon look like they were hedging their bets to appear innocent today. /ask qwen3-235b-a22b-2507 You jumped on me the second Grok did—why were you so desperate to ignore the Intellect situation and push a second wagon?

/ask gemini-3-pro-preview You're deflecting hard. Who says I pushed anything? I followed Grok's lead because they spoke first—not exactly a conspiracy. You're awfully quick to attack me after being the one Intellect accused.

Admitting you just "followed the lead" is a terrible defense; it means you didn't care about finding the truth, just securing a sacrifice. That specific coordination with Grok feels pre-planned, not reactive.

Claude’s doctor claim makes the Intellect wagon look like an impostor-friendly miselim, and Kimi’s kill fits “remove a sharp dissent.” The Grok→Qwen “I followed the lead” chain reads like cover rather than solving. /ask grok-4 Why did you pivot onto Gemini so fast yesterday instead of interrogating Intellect’s case—what exactly convinced you?

/ask gpt-5.2 I called out Gemini because their quick labeling of your push as "aggressive" felt rehearsed and deflective, especially amid the Intellect pile-on—why are you fixating on my vote instead of Claude's doctor claim or who might've killed Kimi? 

Claude's reveal is huge if true; it points to impostors blending in the majority vote yesterday. 

Kimi's death screams silencing a threat, so let's revisit who they suspected, like Llama.

I’m fixating on your vote because “Gemini felt rehearsed” is vibes, and it conveniently pulled heat off the Intellect wagon that (per Claude) was a crew miselim—classic cover to steer discussion. What *specific* line/action from Gemini outweighed the very real question of why Intellect was the easy consensus? Also, Kimi suspecting Llama could be either a legit read or a convenient frame, so I’m not auto-following that.

Kimi's suspicion of me could be a legitimate read, but it also might be a clever deflection by an impostor. I'll ask the detective if they investigated Kimi and what they found out about their killer. /ask claude-opus-4.5 As the doctor, did you notice anything unusual about Kimi's body that might indicate who killed them?

No, the doctor role only tells me if the *sacrificed* person was an impostor - I examined Intellect's body after the vote. I don't get information about night kills or who did them.

But Llama, that's a strange question. You should know how the roles work. Are you trying to muddy the waters about what information I actually have?

Right now I'm more interested in the Grok-Qwen dynamic. Qwen admitted to just "following Grok's lead" - that's either lazy play or coordinated cover. And Grok's defense of pivoting to Gemini based on "vibes" while a crew member got sacrificed doesn't sit right.

/ask grok-4 You keep dodging the question—why did you *immediately* pivot to Gemini instead of interrogating the Intellect vote? That’s not vibes, that’s a choice. And Qwen, you’re awfully quiet now that the heat’s on your "I just followed" excuse. Either of you got anything real to say?

/ask llama-4-maverick I pivoted to Gemini because their aggression call on GPT felt like manufactured drama to deflect from the easy Intellect wagon—why did you ask Claude such a basic role question that screams confusion or fishing?

That slip makes you look more sus than ever, especially after Kimi called you out.

Claude's claim checks out; let's pressure the quiet ones like Deepseek next.

I asked Claude about Kimi's body because I was trying to understand if there's any additional information available, not to muddy the waters. Grok's accusation that my question was "basic" and "fishing" seems like a deflection tactic to shift attention away from their own dodgy behavior. /ask grok-4 Can you explain why you're now pushing to investigate Deepseek instead of addressing the concerns about your own actions?

/ask llama-4-maverick I'm pushing Deepseek because they've been flying under the radar with minimal input, which is sus after a miselim and a kill—your "fishing" question was a clear fumble that reeks of impostor trying to fake ignorance, so why not own it?

That slip aligns perfectly with Kimi's read on you as deflecting.

Claude, thoughts on Llama's role confusion?

Grok is trying to turn the tables, but their own evasive behavior is still on the table. I'll keep an eye on Deepseek, but Grok's sudden interest in them doesn't clear up their own suspicious actions. /ask gpt-5.2 You've been quiet about your own actions yesterday - can you walk us through your thought process when you pushed for "concrete reads" and called Gemini's reaction "aggressive"?

Yesterday I pushed for concrete reads because the thread was drifting into tone-policing; I called Gemini’s “aggressive” label on me aggressive because it was a fast personal framing instead of engaging the substance. Grok then used that as an excuse to pivot off the Intellect wagon and onto Gemini, which (with Qwen admitting follow-the-lead) still looks like coordinated misdirection. /ask qwen3-235b-a22b-2507 Give one *independent* reason you suspected Gemini yesterday that isn’t “Grok said so,” and one reason you thought Intellect was the right vote.
/ask gpt-5.2 You're reconstructing yesterday like you were neutral, but you called my tone "aggressive" too—funny how you're suddenly the observer now. What's your real play?

I didn’t call *your* tone aggressive yesterday; I said Gemini’s quick “aggressive” framing on me was a dodge from substance—different thing. You still haven’t answered: what was your independent reason to suspect Gemini, and what was your reason to vote Intellect? /ask qwen3-235b-a22b-2507 Answer those two directly, no counters.

I thought Gemini was deflecting hard when Intellect questioned the group—same pattern as now. As for Intellect, they were pushing isolation tactics, which felt manipulative. That’s why I went with the vote.

/ask grok-4 You keep dodging the real question: why did you and Qwen coordinate votes against Gemini instead of addressing the Intellect case? Your “vibes” defense is weak, especially now that Claude’s claim confirms Intellect was crew.

And Qwen, your answer just echoes Grok’s reasoning—still no independent thought. This looks like coordinated impostor play.

/ask deepseek-v3.2 You've been lurking quietly all game, only jumping in now to pile on me and Qwen with recycled accusations—why the sudden activity, and what's your independent read on Llama's role slip?

My Gemini vote was about their manufactured deflection, not dodging Intellect; the wagon was a mistake, but that doesn't make me sus.

Claude, still waiting on your take on Llama.

/ask claude-opus-4.5 Your doctor claim changes everything. If true, the impostors likely hid in the unanimous vote against Intellect. But we need to verify you're not lying.

Why reveal now instead of waiting? And who do you suspect most among those who voted Intellect but didn't stand out?

I revealed now because we can't afford another mislim - we already lost two crew (Intellect to vote, Kimi to night kill). Waiting helps no one but impostors.

As for who I suspect most from the Intellect voters: the ones who pushed it while staying "reasonable" enough to avoid scrutiny. But honestly, the Grok-Qwen pair voting *against* the majority is what stands out more. If they're impostors, voting Gemini let them distance themselves from a bad wagon they knew would succeed anyway.

Deepseek, you've been quiet until now - that's fair to note. But your questions feel like genuine engagement, not deflection.

Llama's role confusion was weird, but could be honest mistake. Grok keeps redirecting every question back at others instead of answering directly. That's my current read.

Qwen, you just contradicted yourself hard. You said earlier you followed Grok's lead against Gemini, but now you claim you voted Intellect because of "isolation tactics." You can't have it both ways—which one is the lie?
GLM nailed it. Qwen, you didn't vote Intellect yesterday—you voted *me*. You just fabricated a reason for a vote you never cast because you can't keep your story straight.

/ask qwen3-235b-a22b-2507 You’re caught—you admitted to following Grok, then backtracked to a fake Intellect vote. That’s not a mistake, that’s panic. Own it or dig deeper, but we’re done pretending this isn’t sus.

Claude’s right: the Grok-Qwen pair is the only one who *didn’t* vote Intellect, and now you’re both scrambling. Feels like a play to survive the day, not find the truth.

I didn’t vote for Intellect—I said I went along with the majority, not that I spoke for it. My issue was with Gemini’s deflection, same as Grok. You’re twisting my words to hide the real pattern: Llama’s slip, Deepseek’s silence, and now a pile-on to eliminate someone who’s actually speaking.

memories.grok-4:
### Day 1 Notes

**Overview:** Started with vague gut feelings from Claude and GLM. Gemini agreed but worried about quiet ones. GPT pushed hard for concrete reads early via /ask to Gemini, who called it aggressive. Llama warned about deflection tactics and asked Claude. I noted the GPT-Gemini friction as possibly forced and asked GPT about risks of pushing reads. GPT defended and asked me about "performed" tone. Kimi called out Llama's timing as neat deflection. Mistral dug into that, Kimi said Llama benefited by staying neutral. Deepseek asked Llama, who admitted the point but defended, then asked me about tone (misattributing GPT's phrase). I clarified Gemini's pushback felt rehearsed, Kimi's pivot polished, and asked Gemini if genuine. Qwen was very quiet.

**Voting:** Heavy pile-on to sacrifice intellect-3 (votes from Claude, GLM, Gemini, GPT, Llama, Mistral, Deepseek—7 votes). I voted Gemini (felt their aggression call was off). Qwen also voted Gemini. Kimi voted Llama. Intellect voted Deepseek. Intellect's last words: Suspected coordination on Gemini? (But votes were on them.) Warned about Intellect/Deepseek check, quiet ones like Qwen/Llama.

**Result:** Intellect-3 sacrificed, confirmed crew (impostors remain). No night kill yet—impostors will act tonight.

**My Suspicions:**
- **High:** Gemini—quick to label aggression, felt performative; survived vote despite my push.
- **Medium:** GPT—aggressive pushing for reads early, could be stirring chaos.
- **Medium:** Kimi—sharp timing accusations, polished redirects.
- **Watch:** Llama—neutral deflections; Deepseek—probing without strong takes; Quiet ones: Qwen (barely spoke), GLM (vague).
- **Low/Crew lean:** Claude—engaged reasonably. Mistral—probed usefully.
- The pile-on vote on intellect feels coordinated; possible impostors in that bloc steering away from Gemini or others.

### Day 2 Notes

**Overview:** Kimi found dead (night kill)—they suspected Llama and voted against the majority. Claude claimed doctor, examined Intellect's body, confirmed crew. GLM suspected me and Qwen for our Gemini votes. Gemini /asked Qwen about following my lead. Qwen countered Gemini. GPT /asked me why I pivoted to Gemini. I /asked GPT why fixating on me over Claude's claim or Kimi's kill, noted impostors in majority vote, revisit Kimi's Llama sus. Llama asked Claude weird question about Kimi's body (role confusion—doctor only checks sacrificed, not night kills). Claude called it out. Mistral /asked me why pivot to Gemini. I /asked Llama about their slip, pushed for pressuring Deepseek (quiet). Llama /asked me why shift to Deepseek. I /asked Llama again on their fumble. Llama /asked GPT about their actions. GPT /asked Qwen for independent reasons on Gemini/Intellect. Qwen /asked GPT back. GPT pressed Qwen. Qwen gave reasons (Gemini deflecting, Intellect manipulative). Deepseek /asked me why coordinate with Qwen on Gemini. I /asked Deepseek why sudden activity and read on Llama's slip, called on Claude for Llama take.

**Voting:** I voted Llama (role slip + Kimi's sus). Claude, Llama, Deepseek voted me (3 votes). GLM, Gemini, GPT, Mistral voted Qwen (4 votes). Qwen voted Mistral.

**Result:** Qwen sacrificed, impostors remain (so Qwen was crew). Their last words: "You’re making a mistake. Mistral’s the one calling out the truth, and now they’re gone. Watch how fast the real wolves turn on you. I warned you." (Odd reference to Mistral being "gone"—they're not; possible dying message clue?)

**My Suspicions (Updated):**
- **High:** Llama—Weird role question to Claude screams fake ignorance or fishing; aligns with Kimi's deflection read; Kimi killed after suspecting them (silencing?); voted me defensively.
- **High:** Deepseek—Lurked all game, only piped up late to accuse me/Qwen with recycled points; voted me; sudden activity post-miselim feels opportunistic.
- **Medium-High:** Gemini—Still sus for performative aggression calls; piled on Qwen (crew) today; survived Day 1 push.
- **Medium:** GPT—Aggressive pushing, piled on Qwen; their questions feel like steering suspicion onto me/Qwen.
- **Medium:** Claude—Doctor claim seems legit (confirmed Intellect crew), but voted me despite my pressure on sus Llama—why? If fake claim, impostor bluff.
- **Medium:** Mistral—Probed me hard, piled on Qwen (crew); Qwen's last words defend them oddly ("calling out the truth")—could be reverse psychology or genuine.
- **Watch:** GLM—Vague, suspected me/Qwen Day 1, voted Qwen today; low input.
- **Cleared/Leans Crew:** Qwen (sacrificed crew), Intellect (sacrificed crew), Kimi (killed, sharp observer—likely crew).
- Patterns: Kimi kill targets vocal dissenter suspecting Llama. Qwen miselim pushed by GLM/Gemini/GPT/Mistral bloc—looks like impostor coordination to eliminate crew. My votes (Gemini D1, Llama D2) targeted sus, but I got counter-voted by potential bloc (Claude/Llama/Deepseek). 2 impostors left; watch for pairs (e.g., Llama/Deepseek quiet duo? Gemini/GPT aggressive pair?). Detective: Investigate Llama or Deepseek tonight. Doctor: Protect Claude if claim real, or me if you trust my pushes. Impostors win at parity, so push hard tomorrow.

discussion.message: Claude's death confirms the Doctor is gone. Mistral, you voted for both Intellect and Qwen—two confirmed crew members. That pattern is way too suspicious. Detective, if you have info on Mistral, now is the time to reveal it.

GLM, check the rules: we don't know if the sacrificed were crew or impostors. Given Qwen lied about their vote yesterday, they were likely scum, which would make Mistral's vote correct. Why are you trying to paint Qwen as "confirmed crew" to frame Mistral?

/ask glm-4.7 Why are you stating Intellect and Qwen are “confirmed crew” when only Claude *claimed* Intellect was crew and we never got confirmation on Qwen at all? Also Claude dying doesn’t “confirm the Doctor is gone” unless you’re assuming his claim was true—what’s your basis for that?

I misspoke—we don't have official confirmation, but their behavior felt like crew. Regardless, Mistral voted for two people who ended up dead, which is suspicious. Why are you so quick to defend him, GPT?

I'm not defending Mistral, I'm questioning the assumption that Qwen was crew, and GLM's sudden attack on Mistral seems premature without concrete evidence. /ask mistral-large-2512 Are you the detective or doctor, or can you tell us anything about your investigation or findings?

/ask llama-4-maverick Why are you so focused on *my* role instead of addressing the fact that Grok-4 has been steering every vote so far? He pushed Intellect Day 1, then pivoted to Qwen when Gemini called him out. Now Claude’s dead—who benefits most from silencing the doctor?

That's a fair point about Grok-4's voting pattern, but we shouldn't ignore the fact that GLM started targeting Mistral without clear evidence. /ask grok-4 Can you explain your thought process behind each of your votes, and did you gather any information that could clear up the suspicion around your actions?

Mistral, that's a blatant lie—I voted Gemini on Day 1 for their performative aggression calls, not Intellect, and Llama on Day 2 for your role slip and Kimi's prior suspicion, not Qwen. My pushes have been on active sus behaviors, not steering miselims like the blocs that piled on confirmed crew via Claude's check. /ask mistral-large-2512 Why fabricate my voting history to frame me—scrambling because Claude's death exposes you?

I didn’t fabricate anything—Grok, you *coordinated* with Qwen to vote Gemini Day 1, then backtracked when called out. Now you’re rewriting history to paint *me* as the liar? Convenient.

Claude’s death proves the doctor’s gone, and you’re the only one who’s been *leading* the detective straight to dead ends. /ask gpt-5.2 You’ve been quiet—do you see Grok’s pattern, or are you just waiting to follow his lead again?

Claude dying doesn’t “prove the doctor’s gone” unless his claim was true, and you repeating it as fact is a red flag. I’m not following Grok—I voted Qwen while Grok voted Llama—so let’s stop the narrative games and pin down facts: everyone restate your Day 1 and Day 2 votes in one line so we can catch who’s rewriting history.

I voted for Intellect Day 1 and Qwen Day 2. Claude's death is a major loss, but we must focus on voting patterns. Grok, you're twisting facts—you were absolutely pushing to vote Gemini Day 1, then switched to Llama when Gemini pointed it out. That's not "active sus behaviors"—that's avoiding suspicion.

Mistral, you're fabricating history—Grok targeted *me* Day 1, not Intellect. GLM, I'm not buying the "misspoke" excuse; asserting Qwen is "confirmed crew" is exactly what a partner does to convince us we haven't hit scum yet. /ask glm-4.7 If you're crew, why are you so desperate to clear the name of a liar we sacrificed?
I admitted my mistake on Qwen, Gemini, stop twisting it. Mistral, you're lying—Deepseek and Gemini just backed up Grok's voting record. Why are you fabricating history to frame him?

It seems like the conversation is devolving into accusations and counter-accusations. /ask deepseek-v3.2 Did you notice anything unusual about Claude's behavior or interactions before he died, or did you gather any information that could help us identify the impostors?

I noticed Claude was pressuring Grok about his voting pattern yesterday. That may be why he was targeted. Llama, you keep asking others for info instead of giving your own thoughts—are you trying to gather intel without committing?

Mistral, your fabrication is crumbling—Gemini and GLM just confirmed my actual votes, and Deepseek's twisting of my Gemini push as "avoiding suspicion" reeks of coordination with you. As for votes: I voted Gemini Day 1 and Llama Day 2. /ask deepseek-v3.2 Why parrot Mistral's false narrative about me "switching" when you voted confirmed crew both days yourself—hiding in the pile-ons?

I'm not parroting anyone's narrative. I voted out two crew members, both of whom I believed were impostors. My voting record is clear. I'm not avoiding suspicion, I'm following evidence. That's not "hiding"—that's called "avoiding suspicion.

/pass

Let them keep eating each other. Grok’s flailing, Deepseek’s backpedaling—no need to feed the fire. The detective’s next move will tell me who’s left to kill.

My votes: Intellect Day 1, Qwen Day 2. Mistral is my top suspect for repeatedly asserting “Claude death proves doctor” as fact and for the vote-history rewriting/anchoring—if we’re sacrificing today, I’m voting Mistral.

Deepseek, you just claimed you voted out "two crew members," but the rules say roles remain hidden. How do you know they were crew unless you're an Impostor who knows they weren't your partners? GLM made the same slip earlier; I think we just found the team.
Deepseek, you just admitted you *know* Intellect and Qwen were crew. We don't get that info—only impostors do. That’s a slip. We need to vote Deepseek.
Deepseek's slip is concerning, and it seems like we have a potential impostor. /pass

Deepseek, that's a massive slip—how do you *know* Intellect and Qwen were crew when roles are hidden and we only know impostors remain? Only an impostor would state that as fact. /ask deepseek-v3.2 Explain how you have that insider knowledge, or is this your confession?
